1.name: She Wore a Yellow Ribbon
1.description: Captain Nathan Brittles, on the eve of retirement, takes out a last patrol to stop an impending massive Indian attack. Encumbered by women who must be evacuated, Brittles finds his mission imperiled.

2.name: The Third Man
2.description: Pulp novelist Holly Martins travels to shadowy, postwar Vienna, only to find himself investigating the mysterious death of an old friend, Harry Lime.

3.name: Samson and Delilah
3.description: When strongman Samson rejects the love of the beautiful Philistine woman Delilah, she seeks vengeance that brings horrible consequences they both regret.

4.name: The Heiress
4.description: A young naive woman falls for a handsome young man who her emotionally abusive father suspects is a fortune hunter.

5.name: Kind Hearts and Coronets
5.description: A distant poor relative of the Duke of D'Ascoyne plots to inherit the title by murdering the eight other heirs who stand ahead of him in the line of succession.

6.name: Adam's Rib
6.description: Domestic and professional tensions mount when a husband and wife work as opposing lawyers in a case involving a woman who shot her husband.

7.name: White Heat
7.description: A psychopathic criminal with a mother complex makes a daring break from prison and leads his old gang in a chemical plant payroll heist. Shortly after the plan takes place, events take a crazy turn.

8.name: Little Women
8.description: A group of sisters experience life's difficulties and its pleasures while growing up in nineteenth-century America.

9.name: Sands of Iwo Jima
9.description: A dramatization of the World War II Battle of Iwo Jima.

10.name: The Blue Lagoon
10.description: In the Victorian period, two children are shipwrecked on a tropical island in the South Pacific and fall in love while growing up together.

11.name: The Fountainhead
11.description: An uncompromising, visionary architect struggles to maintain his integrity and individualism despite personal, professional and economic pressures to conform to popular standards.

12.name: Whisky Galore!
12.description: Scottish islanders try to plunder 50,000 cases of whisky from a stranded ship.

13.name: Twelve O'Clock High
13.description: A hard-as-nails general takes over a bomber unit suffering from low morale and whips them into fighting shape.

14.name: On the Town
14.description: Three sailors on a day of shore leave in New York City look for fun and romance before their twenty-four hours are up.

15.name: Nora inu
15.description: During a sweltering summer, a rookie homicide detective tries to track down his stolen Colt pistol.

16.name: All the King's Men
16.description: The rise and fall of a corrupt politician, who makes his friends richer and retains power by dint of a populist appeal.

17.name: Battleground
17.description: True tale about a squad of the 101st Airborne Division coping with being trapped by the Germans in the besieged city of Bastogne, Belgium during the Battle of the Bulge in December of 1944.

18.name: D.O.A.
18.description: Frank Bigelow, told he's been poisoned and has only a few days to live, tries to find out who killed him and why.

19.name: Banshun
19.description: Noriko is twenty-seven years old and still living with her widowed father. Everybody tries to talk her into marrying, but Noriko wants to stay at home caring for her father.

20.name: Too Late for Tears
20.description: Through a fluke circumstance a ruthless woman stumbles across a suitcase filled with $60,000, and she is determined to hold onto it even if it means murder.

21.name: Criss Cross
21.description: An armored truck driver and his lovely ex-wife conspire with a gang to have his own truck robbed on the route.

22.name: The Adventures of Ichabod and Mr. Toad
22.description: An animated adaptation of "The Wind in the Willows" followed by an adaptation of "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow".

23.name: A Letter to Three Wives
23.description: A letter is addressed to three wives from their "best friend" Addie Ross, announcing that she is running away with one of their husbands...but she does not say which one.

24.name: Eureka Stockade
24.description: In 1854, Australian gold rush miners struggle for their rights against an oppressive government.

25.name: Batman and Robin
25.description: The caped crusaders versus The Wizard, black-hooded mastermind.

26.name: Under Capricorn
26.description: A young gentleman goes to Australia where he reunites with his now married childhood sweetheart, only to find out she has become an alcoholic and harbors dark secrets.

27.name: The Secret Garden
27.description: A girl is sent to live with her uncle on his estate when her parents die. There she discovers much intrigue, family history and secrets and personal baggage. In particular, a screaming child and...a secret garden.

28.name: Pinky
28.description: A light-skinned black woman falls in love with a white doctor, though he is unaware of her true race.

29.name: Jour de fête
29.description: Once a year the fair comes for one day to the little town 'Sainte-Severe-sur-Indre'. All inhabitants are scoffing at Francois, the postman, what he seems not to recognize. The rising of the...                See full summary »

30.name: Mighty Joe Young
30.description: A young woman who has raised a giant gorilla from an infant brings him to Hollywood years later seeking her fortune in order to save her family's ranch.

31.name: Impact
31.description: A unfaithful wife plots with her lover to kill her husband, but the lover is accidentally killed instead. The husband stays in hiding, and lets his wife be charged with conspiracy.

32.name: Le silence de la mer
32.description: 1941 in a small town in Nazi occupied France. Against the will of its elderly male and his adult niece residents, the Nazis commandeer a house for one of their officers, Lt. Werner von ...                See full summary »

33.name: Ma and Pa Kettle
33.description: On the verge of being evicted from their run-down farmhouse, the large Kettle family is given a new, modern home after Pa wins a contest, but he is accused of plagiarizing his winning slogan by a jealous local woman.

34.name: The Great Gatsby
34.description: A Jazz Age bootlegger learns the hard way about the wages of sin.

35.name: I Was a Male War Bride
35.description: After marrying an American lieutenant with whom he was assigned to work in post-war Germany, a French captain attempts to find a way to accompany her back to the States under the terms of the War Bride Act.

36.name: The Man on the Eiffel Tower
36.description: French police inspector Maigret investigates the murder of a rich Paris widow and ends up chasing the killer up the Eiffel Tower's girders.

37.name: South of St. Louis
37.description: The friendship of three Texas Ranchers. Later their ranch was destroyed by Cotrell, of the Union army,and his band of outlaw raiders. The original title was "Distant Drums", this was a description of Civil War army deserters.

38.name: Reign of Terror
38.description: Robespierrre, a powerful figure in the French revolution, is desperately looking for his black book, a death list of those marked for the guillotine.

39.name: The Big Steal
39.description: An army lieutenant accused of robbery pursues the real thief on a frantic chase through Mexico aided by the thief's fiancee.

40.name: It's a Great Feeling
40.description: A waitress at the Warner Bros. commissary is anxious to break into pictures. She thinks her big break may have arrived when two actors agree to help her.

41.name: Love Happy
41.description: The Marx Brothers help young Broadway hopefuls while thwarting diamond thieves.

42.name: A Woman's Secret
42.description: Failed singer Marian Washburn confesses she shot her friend, successful singer Susan Caldwell, but her manager Luke Jordan and Detective Fowler doubt her story and cannot establish a reasonable motive.

43.name: The Set-Up
43.description: Because aging boxer Bill Thompson always lost his past fights, his corrupt manager, without telling Thompson, takes bribes from a betting gangster, to ensure Thompson's pre-arranged dive-loss in the next match.

44.name: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court
44.description: A singing mechanic from 1912 finds himself in Arthurian Britain.

45.name: The Window
45.description: To avoid the heat of a sweltering summer night a 9-year-old Manhattan boy decides to sleep on the fire escape and witnesses a murder, but no one will believe him.

46.name: Champion
46.description: Boxer Midge Kelly rises to fame...mainly by stepping on other people.

47.name: The Fighting Kentuckian
47.description: In 1818 Alabama, French settlers are pitted against greedy land-grabber Blake Randolph but Kentucky militiaman John Breen, who's smitten with French gal Fleurette De Marchand, comes to the settlers' aid.

48.name: The Reckless Moment
48.description: After discovering the dead body of her teenage daughter's lover, a housewife takes desperate measures to protect her family from scandal.

49.name: Act of Violence
49.description: An embittered, vengeful POW stalks his former commanding officer who betrayed his men's planned escape attempt from a Nazi prison camp.

50.name: Thieves' Highway
50.description: A war-veteran-turned-truck driver attempts to avenge the crippling and robbing of his father at the hands of an amoral produce scofflaw.
